page.title: 17RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Aberdeen's railway station is at Guild St,comprising both goods and passenger facilities.It is situated adjacent to the harbour area. Once famous for its daily "fish trains",it was said that Billingsgate's freshest fish was from Aberdeen! Usage of the goods station has declined with freight increasingly going by road. The station is presently being renovated as an open plan station with no ticket barriers. Typical of certain trains is the high percentage of oil workers travelling to and from and Aberdeen.Easily identified by thermal jackets and sports bags they alight en masse and race along the platform to the nearest taxi rank and thence to the heliport at Dyce.These trains are also characterised by their high spirit and alcohol levels!
